meanings.definition: Evidence or argument establishing a fact or the truth of a statement.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints found at the crime scene were clear proof of the suspect's presence.
meanings.sent2: The DNA test provided undeniable proof of the biological relationship between the siblings.
meanings.sent3: The detective chuckled, saying, 'Well, that's the proof we needed to crack the case!'
meanings.sent4: Her success in the competition was living proof of her dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph served as a poignant proof of their long-lasting friendship.

meanings.definition: A trial print of a page, taken from type or film and used for making corrections before final printing.
meanings.sent1: The author carefully examined the proof of the book before giving the final approval for printing.
meanings.sent2: The proof revealed a few typos that needed to be corrected before mass production.
meanings.sent3: The printer joked, 'I wish all proofs were as error-free as this one!'
meanings.sent4: The proof showed a slight misalignment that needed adjustment before the final print.
meanings.sent5: The graphic designer always double-checks the proofs to ensure perfection in the final product.

meanings.definition: A measure of the strength of an alcoholic drink.
meanings.sent1: The bartender explained that the alcohol proof of the whiskey was 80, indicating its potency.
meanings.sent2: The label on the bottle displayed the proof of the vodka, revealing its high alcohol content.
meanings.sent3: At the party, he jokingly said, 'Let's see who can handle a drink with the highest proof!'
meanings.sent4: The cocktail's low proof made it a popular choice among those looking for a milder option.
meanings.sent5: She preferred beverages with lower proof to enjoy the flavors without the strong alcohol taste.
